    MarketingHandling Customer Feedback & Reviews via SMSRyan Roberts•Apr 4, 2025Handling Customer Feedback & Reviews via SMSIn the fast-paced world of the restaurant industry, the way you handle customer feedback can make or break your business. With the advent of technology, gathering and managing reviews has become easier than ever. One powerful tool at your disposal is SMS communication. If you're an SMB restaurant owner, here's how you can effectively collect customer feedback and utilize it to enhance your reputation.The Importance of Customer ReviewsCustomer reviews play a critical role in influencing potential diners. A high rating on Google can significantly improve your restaurant’s visibility in search results, enhance credibility, and ultimately drive foot traffic to your location. Restaurants with higher ratings and more reviews tend to attract more customers. Nearly 80% of consumers read online reviews before visiting a restaurant. Thus, managing your feedback process isn't just about handling complaints; it’s an essential strategy for growth.Automating Customer Feedback RequestsTo streamline the feedback collection process, consider implementing automated review requests via SMS after each customer interaction—be it a food order, an in-house dining experience, or a takeout order. This method ensures you're reaching your customers right after their experience, when their memories and emotions are freshest.Here’s how it works:1. Send Automated SMS Requests: As soon as the order is completed, an SMS is automatically sent to the customer thanking them for their business and asking for feedback.2. Capture Sentiment: To simplify the feedback process, invite customers to express their feelings using a selection of emojis. Emojis can capture a range of sentiments, from joy to disappointment, in a way that text may not.3. Direct Feedback Routing: Based on their emoji selection, customers can be routed to different platforms. If they respond positively—perhaps with a smiley face—they can be directed to leave a review on Google. If they express negative feelings—like a sad or upset emoji—they can be encouraged to provide feedback through an internal suggestion box. This way, you can address their concerns directly without risking a public negative review.The Impact of Positive ReviewsCollecting positive reviews through this method can result in significant benefits for your restaurant:- Enhanced Search Engine Optimization (SEO): Google takes the number and quality of reviews into account when ranking businesses. More positive reviews signal to search engines that your restaurant is reputable and trustworthy, increasing your chances of appearing in local search results.- Increased Foot Traffic: A higher search ranking not only enhances visibility but also drives more foot traffic through your doors. As more customers discover positive reviews about your restaurant, they’re more likely to choose your establishment over competitors.- Strengthened Customer Relationships: By encouraging feedback—both good and bad—you also demonstrate that you value your customers' opinions. This can foster loyalty and turn one-time diners into regular patrons.ConclusionFor SMB restaurant owners, handling customer feedback effectively can serve as a catalyst for growth. By automating the feedback process and utilizing SMS to solicit reviews, you're not only streamlining communication but also enhancing your online reputation. Remember that every piece of feedback is an opportunity for improvement and growth.Harness the power of SMS for customer feedback today, and watch your restaurant thrive through positive reviews and increased customer satisfaction!  By prioritizing and managing customer experiences, you place your restaurant in a position to compete effectively in a crowded marketplace. paragraphs: Handling Customer Feedback & Reviews via SMS

In the fast-paced world of the restaurant industry, the way you handle customer feedback can make or break your business. With the advent of technology, gathering and managing reviews has become easier than ever. One powerful tool at your disposal is SMS communication. If you're an SMB restaurant owner, here's how you can effectively collect customer feedback and utilize it to enhance your reputation.

Customer reviews play a critical role in influencing potential diners. A high rating on Google can significantly improve your restaurant’s visibility in search results, enhance credibility, and ultimately drive foot traffic to your location. Restaurants with higher ratings and more reviews tend to attract more customers. Nearly 80% of consumers read online reviews before visiting a restaurant. Thus, managing your feedback process isn't just about handling complaints; it’s an essential strategy for growth.

To streamline the feedback collection process, consider implementing automated review requests via SMS after each customer interaction—be it a food order, an in-house dining experience, or a takeout order. This method ensures you're reaching your customers right after their experience, when their memories and emotions are freshest.
1. Send Automated SMS Requests: As soon as the order is completed, an SMS is automatically sent to the customer thanking them for their business and asking for feedback.

2. Capture Sentiment: To simplify the feedback process, invite customers to express their feelings using a selection of emojis. Emojis can capture a range of sentiments, from joy to disappointment, in a way that text may not.

3. Direct Feedback Routing: Based on their emoji selection, customers can be routed to different platforms. If they respond positively—perhaps with a smiley face—they can be directed to leave a review on Google. If they express negative feelings—like a sad or upset emoji—they can be encouraged to provide feedback through an internal suggestion box. This way, you can address their concerns directly without risking a public negative review.
